speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Do not let your hearts be troubled. You believe in God; believe also in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My Father’s house has many rooms; if that were not so, would I have told you that I am going there to prepare a place for you?
speaker: Narrator

text: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come back and take you to be with me that you also may be where I am.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know the way to the place where I am going.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Thomas said to him, ‘Lord, we don’t know where you are going, so how can we know the way?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, ‘I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you really know me, you will know my Father as well. From now on, you do know him and have seen him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip said, ‘Lord, show us the Father and that will be enough for us.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered: ‘Don’t you know me, Philip, even after I have been among you such a long time? Anyone who has seen me has seen the Father. How can you say, “Show us the Father”?
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t you believe that I am in the Father, and that the Father is in me? The words I say to you I do not speak on my own authority. Rather, it is the Father, living in me, who is doing his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Believe me when I say that I am in the Father and the Father is in me; or at least believe on the evidence of the works themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Very truly I tell you, whoever believes in me will do the works I have been doing, and they will do even greater things than these, because I am going to the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will do whatever you ask in my name, so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: You may ask me for anything in my name, and I will do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘If you love me, keep my commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another advocate to help you and be with you for ever –
speaker: Narrator

text: the Spirit of truth. The world cannot accept him, because it neither sees him nor knows him. But you know him, for he lives with you and will be in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not leave you as orphans; I will come to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before long, the world will not see me any more, but you will see me. Because I live, you also will live.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day you will realise that I am in my Father, and you are in me, and I am in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever has my commands and keeps them is the one who loves me. The one who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I too will love them and show myself to them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judas (not Judas Iscariot) said, ‘But, Lord, why do you intend to show yourself to us and not to the world?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied, ‘Anyone who loves me will obey my teaching. My Father will love them, and we will come to them and make our home with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anyone who does not love me will not obey my teaching. These words you hear are not my own; they belong to the Father who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘All this I have spoken while still with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Advocate, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you all things and will remind you of everything I have said to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You heard me say, “I am going away and I am coming back to you.” If you loved me, you would be glad that I am going to the Father, for the Father is greater than I.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have told you now before it happens, so that when it does happen you will believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not say much more to you, for the prince of this world is coming. He has no hold over me,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but he comes so that the world may learn that I love the Father and do exactly what my Father has commanded me.
‘Come now; let us leave.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I am the true vine, and my Father is the gardener.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cuts off every branch in me that bears no fruit, while every branch that does bear fruit he prunes so that it will be even more fruitful.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are already clean because of the word I have spoken to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remain in me, as I also remain in you. No branch can bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you do not remain in me, you are like a branch that is thrown away and withers; such branches are picked up, thrown into the fire and burned.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you remain in me and my words remain in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be done for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is to my Father’s glory, that you bear much fruit, showing yourselves to be my disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘As the Father has loved me, so have I loved you. Now remain in my love.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you keep my commands, you will remain in my love, just as I have kept my Father’s commands and remain in his love.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have told you this so that my joy may be in you and that your joy may be complete.
speaker: Narrator

text: My command is this: love each other as I have loved you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greater love has no one than this: to lay down one’s life for one’s friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are my friends if you do what I command.
speaker: Narrator

text: I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know his master’s business. Instead, I have called you friends, for everything that I learned from my Father I have made known to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You did not choose me, but I chose you and appointed you so that you might go and bear fruit – fruit that will last – and so that whatever you ask in my name the Father will give you.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is my command: love each other.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘If the world hates you, keep in mind that it hated me first.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you belonged to the world, it would love you as its own. As it is, you do not belong to the world, but I have chosen you out of the world. That is why the world hates you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember what I told you: “A servant is not greater than his master.” If they persecuted me, they will persecute you also. If they obeyed my teaching, they will obey yours also.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will treat you this way because of my name, for they do not know the one who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever hates me hates my Father as well.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I had not done among them the works no one else did, they would not be guilty of sin. As it is, they have seen, and yet they have hated both me and my Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this is to fulfil what is written in their Law: “They hated me without reason.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘When the Advocate comes, whom I will send to you from the Father – the Spirit of truth who goes out from the Father – he will testify about me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you also must testify, for you have been with me from the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘All this I have told you so that you will not fall away.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will put you out of the synagogue; in fact, the time is coming when anyone who kills you will think they are offering a service to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will do such things because they have not known the Father or me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have told you this, so that when their time comes you will remember that I warned you about them. I did not tell you this from the beginning because I was with you,
speaker: Narrator

text: but now I am going to him who sent me. None of you asks me, “Where are you going?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Rather, you are filled with grief because I have said these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: But very truly I tell you, it is for your good that I am going away. Unless I go away, the Advocate will not come to you; but if I go, I will send him to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he comes, he will prove the world to be in the wrong about sin and righteousness and judgment:
speaker: Narrator

text: about sin, because people do not believe in me;
speaker: Narrator

text: about righteousness, because I am going to the Father, where you can see me no longer;
speaker: Narrator

text: and about judgment, because the prince of this world now stands condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I have much more to say to you, more than you can now bear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all the truth. He will not speak on his own; he will speak only what he hears, and he will tell you what is yet to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will glorify me because it is from me that he will receive what he will make known to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that belongs to the Father is mine. That is why I said the Spirit will receive from me what he will make known to you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went on to say, ‘In a little while you will see me no more, and then after a little while you will see me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: At this, some of his disciples said to one another, ‘What does he mean by saying, “In a little while you will see me no more, and then after a little while you will see me,” and “Because I am going to the Father”?’
speaker: Narrator

text: They kept asking, ‘What does he mean by “a little while”? We don’t understand what he is saying.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saw that they wanted to ask him about this, so he said to them, ‘Are you asking one another what I meant when I said, “In a little while you will see me no more, and then after a little while you will see me”?
speaker: Narrator

text: Very truly I tell you, you will weep and mourn while the world rejoices. You will grieve, but your grief will turn to joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman giving birth to a child has pain because her time has come; but when her baby is born she forgets the anguish because of her joy that a child is born into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: So with you: now is your time of grief, but I will see you again and you will rejoice, and no one will take away your joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day you will no longer ask me anything. Very truly I tell you, my Father will give you whatever you ask in my name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until now you have not asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive, and your joy will be complete.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Though I have been speaking figuratively, a time is coming when I will no longer use this kind of language but will tell you plainly about my Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day you will ask in my name. I am not saying that I will ask the Father on your behalf.
speaker: Narrator

text: No, the Father himself loves you because you have loved me and have believed that I came from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I came from the Father and entered the world; now I am leaving the world and going back to the Father.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus’ disciples said, ‘Now you are speaking clearly and without figures of speech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we can see that you know all things and that you do not even need to have anyone ask you questions. This makes us believe that you came from God.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Do you now believe?’ Jesus replied.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘A time is coming and in fact has come when you will be scattered, each to your own home. You will leave me all alone. Yet I am not alone, for my Father is with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I have told you these things, so that in me you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
After Jesus said this, he looked towards heaven and prayed:
‘Father, the hour has come. Glorify your Son, that your Son may glorify you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you granted him authority over all people that he might give eternal life to all those you have given him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this is eternal life: that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have brought you glory on earth by finishing the work you gave me to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, Father, glorify me in your presence with the glory I had with you before the world began.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I have revealed you to those whom you gave me out of the world. They were yours; you gave them to me and they have obeyed your word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they know that everything you have given me comes from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I gave them the words you gave me and they accepted them. They knew with certainty that I came from you, and they believed that you sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray for them. I am not praying for the world, but for those you have given me, for they are yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: All I have is yours, and all you have is mine. And glory has come to me through them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will remain in the world no longer, but they are still in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, protect them by the power of your name, the name you gave me, so that they may be one as we are one.
speaker: Narrator

text: While I was with them, I protected them and kept them safe by that name you gave me. None has been lost except the one doomed to destruction so that Scripture would be fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I am coming to you now, but I say these things while I am still in the world, so that they may have the full measure of my joy within them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have given them your word and the world has hated them, for they are not of the world any more than I am of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: My prayer is not that you take them out of the world but that you protect them from the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are not of the world, even as I am not of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sanctify them by the truth; your word is truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As you sent me into the world, I have sent them into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: For them I sanctify myself, that they too may be truly sanctified.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘My prayer is not for them alone. I pray also for those who will believe in me through their message,
speaker: Narrator

text: that all of them may be one, Father, just as you are in me and I am in you. May they also be in us so that the world may believe that you have sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have given them the glory that you gave me, that they may be one as we are one –
speaker: Narrator

text: I in them and you in me – so that they may be brought to complete unity. Then the world will know that you sent me and have loved them even as you have loved me.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Father, I want those you have given me to be with me where I am, and to see my glory, the glory you have given me because you loved me before the creation of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Righteous Father, though the world does not know you, I know you, and they know that you have sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have made you known to them, and will continue to make you known in order that the love you have for me may be in them and that I myself may be in them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had finished praying, Jesus left with his disciples and crossed the Kidron Valley. On the other side there was a garden, and he and his disciples went into it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Judas, who betrayed him, knew the place, because Jesus had often met there with his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Judas came to the garden, guiding a detachment of soldiers and some officials from the chief priests and the Pharisees. They were carrying torches, lanterns and weapons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, knowing all that was going to happen to him, went out and asked them, ‘Who is it you want?’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Jesus of Nazareth,’ they replied.
‘I am he,’ Jesus said. (And Judas the traitor was standing there with them.)
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus said, ‘I am he,’ they drew back and fell to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Again he asked them, ‘Who is it you want?’
‘Jesus of Nazareth,’ they said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, ‘I told you that I am he. If you are looking for me, then let these men go.’
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened so that the words he had spoken would be fulfilled: ‘I have not lost one of those you gave me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the high priest’s servant, cutting off his right ear. (The servant’s name was Malchus.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus commanded Peter, ‘Put your sword away! Shall I not drink the cup the Father has given me?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the detachment of soldiers with its commander and the Jewish officials arrested Jesus. They bound him
speaker: Narrator

text: and brought him first to Annas, who was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the high priest that year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Jewish leaders that it would be good if one man died for the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter and another disciple were following Jesus. Because this disciple was known to the high priest, he went with Jesus into the high priest’s courtyard,
speaker: Narrator

text: but Peter had to wait outside at the door. The other disciple, who was known to the high priest, came back, spoke to the servant-girl on duty there and brought Peter in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘You aren’t one of this man’s disciples too, are you?’ she asked Peter.
He replied, ‘I am not.’
speaker: Narrator

text: It was cold, and the servants and officials stood round a fire they had made to keep warm. Peter also was standing with them, warming himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, the high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and his teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I have spoken openly to the world,’ Jesus replied. ‘I always taught in synagogues or at the temple, where all the Jews come together. I said nothing in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why question me? Ask those who heard me. Surely they know what I said.’
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus said this, one of the officials near by slapped him in the face. ‘Is this the way you answer the high priest?’ he demanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘If I said something wrong,’ Jesus replied, ‘testify as to what is wrong. But if I spoke the truth, why did you strike me?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Meanwhile, Simon Peter was still standing there warming himself. So they asked him, ‘You aren’t one of his disciples too, are you?’
He denied it, saying, ‘I am not.’
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the high priest’s servants, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, challenged him, ‘Didn’t I see you with him in the garden?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Again Peter denied it, and at that moment a cock began to crow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jewish leaders took Jesus from Caiaphas to the palace of the Roman governor. By now it was early morning, and to avoid ceremonial uncleanness they did not enter the palace, because they wanted to be able to eat the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate came out to them and asked, ‘What charges are you bringing against this man?’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘If he were not a criminal,’ they replied, ‘we would not have handed him over to you.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pilate said, ‘Take him yourselves and judge him by your own law.’
‘But we have no right to execute anyone,’ they objected.
speaker: Narrator

text: This took place to fulfil what Jesus had said about the kind of death he was going to die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate then went back inside the palace, summoned Jesus and asked him, ‘Are you the king of the Jews?’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Is that your own idea,’ Jesus asked, ‘or did others talk to you about me?’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Am I a Jew?’ Pilate replied. ‘Your own people and chief priests handed you over to me. What is it you have done?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, ‘My kingdom is not of this world. If it were, my servants would fight to prevent my arrest by the Jewish leaders. But now my kingdom is from another place.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘You are a king, then!’ said Pilate.
Jesus answered, ‘You say that I am a king. In fact, the reason I was born and came into the world is to testify to the truth. Everyone on the side of truth listens to me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘What is truth?’ retorted Pilate. With this he went out again to the Jews gathered there and said, ‘I find no basis for a charge against him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it is your custom for me to release to you one prisoner at the time of the Passover. Do you want me to release “the king of the Jews”?’
speaker: Narrator

text: They shouted back, ‘No, not him! Give us Barabbas!’ Now Barabbas had taken part in an uprising.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soldiers twisted together a crown of thorns and put it on his head. They clothed him in a purple robe
speaker: Narrator

text: and went up to him again and again, saying, ‘Hail, king of the Jews!’ And they slapped him in the face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once more Pilate came out and said to the Jews gathered there, ‘Look, I am bringing him out to you to let you know that I find no basis for a charge against him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe, Pilate said to them, ‘Here is the man!’
speaker: Narrator

text:
As soon as the chief priests and their officials saw him, they shouted, ‘Crucify! Crucify!’
But Pilate answered, ‘You take him and crucify him. As for me, I find no basis for a charge against him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jewish leaders insisted, ‘We have a law, and according to that law he must die, because he claimed to be the Son of God.’
speaker: Narrator

text: When Pilate heard this, he was even more afraid,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he went back inside the palace. ‘Where do you come from?’ he asked Jesus, but Jesus gave him no answer.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Do you refuse to speak to me?’ Pilate said. ‘Don’t you realise I have power either to free you or to crucify you?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, ‘You would have no power over me if it were not given to you from above. Therefore the one who handed me over to you is guilty of a greater sin.’
speaker: Narrator

text: From then on, Pilate tried to set Jesus free, but the Jewish leaders kept shouting, ‘If you let this man go, you are no friend of Caesar. Anyone who claims to be a king opposes Caesar.’
speaker: Narrator

text: When Pilate heard this, he brought Jesus out and sat down on the judge’s seat at a place known as the Stone Pavement (which in Aramaic is Gabbatha).
speaker: Narrator

text:
It was the day of Preparation of the Passover; it was about noon.
‘Here is your king,’ Pilate said to the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But they shouted, ‘Take him away! Take him away! Crucify him!’
‘Shall I crucify your king?’ Pilate asked.
‘We have no king but Caesar,’ the chief priests answered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Finally Pilate handed him over to them to be crucified.
So the soldiers took charge of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Carrying his own cross, he went out to the place of the Skull (which in Aramaic is called Golgotha).
speaker: Narrator

text: There they crucified him, and with him two others – one on each side and Jesus in the middle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate had a notice prepared and fastened to the cross. It read: jesus of nazareth, the king of the jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many of the Jews read this sign, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and the sign was written in Aramaic, Latin and Greek.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief priests of the Jews protested to Pilate, ‘Do not write “The King of the Jews”, but that this man claimed to be king of the Jews.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate answered, ‘What I have written, I have written.’
speaker: Narrator

text: When the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothes, dividing them into four shares, one for each of them, with the undergarment remaining. This garment was seamless, woven in one piece from top to bottom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Let’s not tear it,’ they said to one another. ‘Let’s decide by lot who will get it.’
This happened that the scripture might be fulfilled that said,
‘They divided my clothes among them
    and cast lots for my garment.’
So this is what the soldiers did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Near the cross of Jesus stood his mother, his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw his mother there, and the disciple whom he loved standing near by, he said to her, ‘Woman, here is your son,’
speaker: Narrator

text: and to the disciple, ‘Here is your mother.’ From that time on, this disciple took her into his home.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later, knowing that everything had now been finished, and so that Scripture would be fulfilled, Jesus said, ‘I am thirsty.’
speaker: Narrator

text: A jar of wine vinegar was there, so they soaked a sponge in it, put the sponge on a stalk of the hyssop plant, and lifted it to Jesus’ lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had received the drink, Jesus said, ‘It is finished.’ With that, he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it was the day of Preparation, and the next day was to be a special Sabbath. Because the Jewish leaders did not want the bodies left on the crosses during the Sabbath, they asked Pilate to have the legs broken and the bodies taken down.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soldiers therefore came and broke the legs of the first man who had been crucified with Jesus, and then those of the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they came to Jesus and found that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, one of the soldiers pierced Jesus’ side with a spear, bringing a sudden flow of blood and water.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man who saw it has given testimony, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, and he testifies so that you also may believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things happened so that the scripture would be fulfilled: ‘Not one of his bones will be broken,’
speaker: Narrator

text: and, as another scripture says, ‘They will look on the one they have pierced.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Later, Joseph of Arimathea asked Pilate for the body of Jesus. Now Joseph was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly because he feared the Jewish leaders. With Pilate’s permission, he came and took the body away.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was accompanied by Nicodemus, the man who earlier had visited Jesus at night. Nicodemus brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about thirty-five kilograms.
speaker: Narrator

text: Taking Jesus’ body, the two of them wrapped it, with the spices, in strips of linen. This was in accordance with Jewish burial customs.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the place where Jesus was crucified, there was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb, in which no one had ever been laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because it was the Jewish day of Preparation and since the tomb was near by, they laid Jesus there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb and saw that the stone had been removed from the entrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: So she came running to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one Jesus loved, and said, ‘They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they have put him!’
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter and the other disciple started for the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both were running, but the other disciple outran Peter and reached the tomb first.
speaker: Narrator

text: He bent over and looked in at the strips of linen lying there but did not go in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simon Peter came along behind him and went straight into the tomb. He saw the strips of linen lying there,
speaker: Narrator

text: as well as the cloth that had been wrapped round Jesus’ head. The cloth was still lying in its place, separate from the linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, also went inside. He saw and believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: (They still did not understand from Scripture that Jesus had to rise from the dead.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples went back to where they were staying.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Mary stood outside the tomb crying. As she wept, she bent over to look into the tomb
speaker: Narrator

text: and saw two angels in white, seated where Jesus’ body had been, one at the head and the other at the foot.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They asked her, ‘Woman, why are you crying?’
‘They have taken my Lord away,’ she said, ‘and I don’t know where they have put him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: At this, she turned round and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not realise that it was Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He asked her, ‘Woman, why are you crying? Who is it you are looking for?’
Thinking he was the gardener, she said, ‘Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will get him.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said to her, ‘Mary.’
She turned towards him and cried out in Aramaic, ‘Rabboni!’ (which means ‘Teacher’).
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, ‘Do not hold on to me, for I have not yet ascended to the Father. Go instead to my brothers and tell them, “I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary Magdalene went to the disciples with the news: ‘I have seen the Lord!’ And she told them that he had said these things to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the evening of that first day of the week, when the disciples were together, with the doors locked for fear of the Jewish leaders, Jesus came and stood among them and said, ‘Peace be with you!’
speaker: Narrator

text: After he said this, he showed them his hands and side. The disciples were overjoyed when they saw the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again Jesus said, ‘Peace be with you! As the Father has sent me, I am sending you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And with that he breathed on them and said, ‘Receive the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you forgive anyone’s sins, their sins are forgiven; if you do not forgive them, they are not forgiven.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Thomas (also known as Didymus), one of the Twelve, was not with the disciples when Jesus came.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So the other disciples told him, ‘We have seen the Lord!’
But he said to them, ‘Unless I see the nail marks in his hands and put my finger where the nails were, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.’
speaker: Narrator

text: A week later his disciples were in the house again, and Thomas was with them. Though the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them and said, ‘Peace be with you!’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to Thomas, ‘Put your finger here; see my hands. Reach out your hand and put it into my side. Stop doubting and believe.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Thomas said to him, ‘My Lord and my God!’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus told him, ‘Because you have seen me, you have believed; blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus performed many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not recorded in this book.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterwards Jesus appeared again to his disciples, by the Sea of Galilee. It happened this way:
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter, Thomas (also known as Didymus), Nathanael from Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples were together.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I’m going out to fish,’ Simon Peter told them, and they said, ‘We’ll go with you.’ So they went out and got into the boat, but that night they caught nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Early in the morning, Jesus stood on the shore, but the disciples did not realise that it was Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He called out to them, ‘Friends, haven’t you any fish?’
‘No,’ they answered.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, ‘Throw your net on the right side of the boat and you will find some.’ When they did, they were unable to haul the net in because of the large number of fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, ‘It is the Lord!’ As soon as Simon Peter heard him say, ‘It is the Lord,’ he wrapped his outer garment round him (for he had taken it off) and jumped into the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: The other disciples followed in the boat, towing the net full of fish, for they were not far from shore, about a hundred metres.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they landed, they saw a fire of burning coals there with fish on it, and some bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, ‘Bring some of the fish you have just caught.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So Simon Peter climbed back into the boat and dragged the net ashore. It was full of large fish, 153, but even with so many the net was not torn.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, ‘Come and have breakfast.’ None of the disciples dared ask him, ‘Who are you?’ They knew it was the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus came, took the bread and gave it to them, and did the same with the fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was now the third time Jesus appeared to his disciples after he was raised from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they had finished eating, Jesus said to Simon Peter, ‘Simon son of John, do you love me more than these?’
‘Yes, Lord,’ he said, ‘you know that I love you.’
Jesus said, ‘Feed my lambs.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Again Jesus said, ‘Simon son of John, do you love me?’
He answered, ‘Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.’
Jesus said, ‘Take care of my sheep.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
The third time he said to him, ‘Simon son of John, do you love me?’
Peter was hurt because Jesus asked him the third time, ‘Do you love me?’ He said, ‘Lord, you know all things; you know that I love you.’
Jesus said, ‘Feed my sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Very truly I tell you, when you were younger you dressed yourself and went where you wanted; but when you are old you will stretch out your hands, and someone else will dress you and lead you where you do not want to go.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said this to indicate the kind of death by which Peter would glorify God. Then he said to him, ‘Follow me!’
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter turned and saw that the disciple whom Jesus loved was following them. (This was the one who had leaned back against Jesus at the supper and had said, ‘Lord, who is going to betray you?’)
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter saw him, he asked, ‘Lord, what about him?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, ‘If I want him to remain alive until I return, what is that to you? You must follow me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of this, the rumour spread among the believers that this disciple would not die. But Jesus did not say that he would not die; he only said, ‘If I want him to remain alive until I return, what is that to you?’
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the disciple who testifies to these things and who wrote them down. We know that his testimony is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus did many other things as well. If every one of them were written down, I suppose that even the whole world would not have room for the books that would be written.
speaker: Narrator
